label: ZV2400TAC-SL-A
info_overview: The knob smart dimmer is a Z-Wave device designed to work with various types of light sources. It may be connected to two-wire or three-wire configuration so it can operate with or without neutral lead. The dimmer can switch or dim connected light source either through Z-Wave devices or through the rotary knob directly. The smart dimmer is equipped with an algorithm of smart light source detection which makes configuration easier and ensures high compatibility of the device. It may be used as a switch with non-dimmable light sources (in 3- wire connection). The dimmer can be included and operated in any Z-Wave network with other Z-Wave certified devices from other manufacturers and/or other applications. All non-battery operated nodes within the network will act as repeaters regardless of vendor to increase reliability of the network. The encryption mode that the dimmer supports is S2 Unauthenticated. When the dimmer is being included into a Z-Wave network, you can use your primary controller/gateway to enable encryption mode or disable encryption. (The primary controller/gateway shall support encryption mode configuration). The dimmer supports OTA and can update firmware wirelessly.
info_inclusion:
There are two methods to set the dimmer into inclusion mode:

  1. Repower on the dimmer, it will be set into inclusion mode automatically, and waiting to be included.
  2. Triple press reset button on the dimmer, it will set the dimmer into inclusion mode. The connected light will stay solid on for 3 seconds to indicate successful inclusion.
info_exclusion:
There are two exclusion methods:

Method 1: Exclusion from the primary controller/gateway as follows:

  1. Set the primary controller/gateway into exclusion mode (Please refer to your primary controllers manual on how to set your controller into exclusion).
  2. Triple press reset button, the dimmer will be set to exclusion mode, and waiting to be excluded, then the dimmer will be excluded from the network.

Method 2: Factory reset the dimmer will force it to be excluded from a network. (please refer to the part “Factory Reset” of this manual) Note: Factory reset is not recommended for exclusion, please use this procedure only if the primary controller/gateway is missing or otherwise inoperable.

category_description: Any device attached to the wall that controls a binary status of something, for ex. a light switch

parameters.label: State before power failure
parameters.description: Saving load state before power failure
parameters.overview:
Info: Saving load state before power failure

0 － shutoff load

1 － turn on load

2 － save load state before power failure

options.label: save load state before power failure

parameters.label: Send Basic report
parameters.description: send the basic report to the Lifeline when the load state changed
parameters.overview: Info: Enable/disable to send the basic report to the Lifeline when the load state changed （When value set as 1, re-power on the dimmer, it will send Basic report automatically）

parameters.label: Default fade time
parameters.overview:
Default fade time (unit is second, this value has the same function as Duration of Multilevel)

Valid value: 0~0xFF

options.label: from 1 to 127 seconds
options.overview: 1 second (0x01) to 127 seconds (0x7F) in 1 second resolution.

options.label: 1  to 127 minutes
options.overview: 1 minute (0x80) to 127 minutes (0xFE) in 1 minute resolution.

parameters.label: Minimum brightness value
parameters.overview: Valid value: 0~50, the bigger the value is, the higher the load’s minimum brightness is

parameters.label: MOSFET driving type
parameters.overview:
Choose MOSFET driving type 

0 – trailing edge

1 – leading edge

parameters.label: Added to and removed from a network
parameters.description: Added to and removed from a network
parameters.overview:
Added to and removed from a network through external switch (when enables this function, triple press the external switch within 1.5 seconds to be added to or removed from a network)

0 - disable

1 - enable

options.label: disable
options.overview: disable

parameters.label: Detect load
parameters.overview:
Enable/disable to detect load after re-power on (detect load type, minimum brightness, maximum brightness)

0 - disable

1 - enable to detect every time after re-power on

2 - enable to detect only after first re-power on Note: When the device does not belong to any network, load detection will be enabled every time after re-power on. When the device has already been added to a network, load detection will be disabled.

options.label: enable
options.overview: enable to detect every time after re-power on

options.label: enable to detect only after first re-power
options.overview: enable to detect only after first re-power on Note: When the device does not belong to any network, load detection will be enabled every time after re-power on. When the device has already been added to a network, load detection will be disabled.

parameters.label: Wiring type
parameters.overview:
Wiring type

0 - unknown

1 - 2 Wire With No Neutral

2 - 3 Wire With Neutral

parameters.label: Over current protection
parameters.overview:
Enable/disable over current protection (over 1.5A for 20 seconds continuously)

0 – disable

1 – enable

options.label: disable
options.overview: disable

parameters.label: Threshold, unit is W
parameters.overview: Power automatic report absolute threshold, unit is W When power changes above the absolute threshold, immediately report current power value

parameters.label: Threshold, unit is %
parameters.overview: Power automatic report percentage threshold, unit is % When power changes above the percentage threshold, immediately report current power value

parameters.label: Power metering time cycle
parameters.overview: Power metering automatic report time cycle, unit is second Valid time cycle value: 5~2678400, when set as 0, report function disabled

parameters.label: Energy metering time cycle
parameters.overview: Energy metering automatic report time cycle, unit is second Valid time cycle value: 5~2678400, when set as 0, report function disabled

parameters.label: Voltage metering time cycle
parameters.overview: Voltage metering automatic report time cycle, unit is second Valid time cycle value: 5~2678400, when set as 0, report function disabled

parameters.label: Current metering time cycle
parameters.overview: Current metering automatic report time cycle, unit is second Valid time cycle value: 5~2678400, when set as 0, report function disabled

associations.label: Lifeline
associations.overview:
1. When press and hold down “Reset” button for 10S to reset the dimmer, send "Device Reset Locally Notification CC" to associated devices of this group to report factory reset information.

2. When load state changes, send "Basic Report CC" to associated devices of this group.

3. When a load over current is detected, send "Over-current detected" to Lifeline.

4. When a mains voltage drop is detected, send "Voltage drop/drift" to Lifeline.

5. When over temperature is detected, send “Emergency shutoff status" to Lifeline.

commandclass.name: NO_OPERATION
commandclass.label: No Operation - used for PINGing a device.

notices: Endpoint 0 has no command class linked to the basic class.
